To add a %1$s, select the Add icon. Once a %1$s is added, selecting the row will change the target%2$s

To remove a %1$s, swipe the row horizontally left or right. Re-order a %1$s in the list by vertically dragging the anchor on the left.

To clear or reset to defaults, select the Reset icon.
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the feature entirely.
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the second pie layer entirely.

Blur personalizations are disabled during keyguard view. Only translucent notifications are enabled.

These colors are the ones tinting the BlurBackground. Instead of the normal Grey, you can now choose the colors in the way you like.
There are three color filters: One used for light backgrounds, one used for Dark backgrounds and one used for light/dark backgrounds.
So how these colors work?
Simple, as the titles say, the Light filter will be used for Lighter backgrounds, Dark filter for dark backgrounds and the mixed filter one will be used for backgrounds not too dark but neither too light.
These colors are used for both BlurBackgrounds: StatusBar and RecentsApps window
Blur personalizations are disabled during keyguard view. Only translucent notifications are enabled.

To clear all apps, pinch-in with two fingers on the panel. To block an app from being cleared, long press on its icon to star it.\n\nFor additional recents features such as multiwindow or to kill an app, long press or drag an app card in the panel.

When unlocked, include options in the power menu for restarting into recovery or bootloader
Permit pulsing the light when Do Not Disturb is active

Ambient Music Ticker shows playing music track info within Ambient display screen.

It's triggered also if Ambient Display is disabled when a new track is started, forcing a clean ambient screen with track info in the middle of the screen.

You can also double tap on track info to skip track.
Dismiss lockscreen automatically after recognizing trusted face
Suitable face unlock package not available

To dismiss your notifications, swipe left or right on the fingerprint sensor on the back of your phone.

Smart pixels is a power saving feature. Depending on how many pixels you decide to turn off, you could see improvement in battery life.

Shut off pixels to reduce power consumption

Prevents burn-in on OLED devices by shifting pixels every so often

- Swipe up on left or right side

Home
- Swipe up center

Recent apps
- Swipe up center and hold

Active volume stream will be displayed on the screen even if disabled here. Volume streams enabled here would be displayed forcefully.
This will reset battery history stats. Would you like to continue?
Display clock in quick status bar header

This mode disables the back button and you can trigger a back button action by a left swipe on navbar. Right swipe still triggers the last-app and the overview apps scrolling. To go home you can tap on any navbar empty space, not only the home button. When keyboard is showing, long press on navbar to move the text cursor.
Tap on an empty navbar space but not the home button to switch the screen off.

Press the Wi\u2011Fi Protected Setup button on your router. It may be called \u201cWPS\u201d or marked with this symbol:
Enter pin %1$s on your Wi\u2011Fi router. The setup can take up to two minutes to complete.
WPS succeeded. Connecting to the network\u2026
WPS is already in progress and can take up to two minutes to complete
WPS failed. Please try again in a few minutes.
The wireless router security setting (WEP) is not supported
The wireless router security setting (TKIP) is not supported
